description: First appears in Middle English circa 1425, derived from Latin unctus (“anointed”) and related terms. Ayurvedic sense is one of several competing translations of Sanskrit snehana.

verbs.description: unct (third-person singular simple present uncts, present participle uncting, simple past and past participle uncted)

entries.meaning: (archaic) To anoint, especially a monarch or other patriarchal leader.
examples: The King was uncted in the nick of time
